question: I thought children in Pennsylvania could enroll in CHIP regardless of household income; why wasn’t my child automatically transferred to the CHIP program when I submitted my application through Pennie?
text:
I thought children in Pennsylvania could enroll in CHIP regardless of household income; why wasnt my child automatically transferred to the CHIP program when I submitted my application through Pennie? 
          
        
Thats true! You can enroll your child in 
CHIP,
 if they otherwise qualify, any time throughout the year.
Pennie makes it easy for you and your family to understand your coverage options regardless of what plans you qualify for. Once you submit a Pennie application and Pennie believes your child likely qualifies for free or low-cost CHIP coverage, their application information will be sent to the Department of Human Services (DHS) to confirm. Pennie does not automatically send a child that is eligible for full-cost CHIP directly over to DHS to ensure that you can see their coverage options through Pennie.
